page.title: 08 ATTITUDES IN LEWES
page.content: Random surveys show common {attitudes}amongst Lewesians. They love the varied{historic buildings,}but don't like climbing the{steep streets. Some see too much{new building, although Lewes' expansion is now severely restricted. They like and use the{community centres}in Landport and Malling, but they'd like Lewes to have its own{Sports Hall, all-weather {running track and covered heated {swimming pool. They value the character of{Lewes {pubs}(only half the number of l886!) but would like to have a{cinema.}They use the{library}but are horrified at the threat of closure to the Music Library. They are determined to see {Lewes Victoria Hospital}stay open. They return a Conservative MP, Liberal County Councillors, and Conservative, Liberal and Independent District Cllrs
